title: Kidney And Nerve Cells Can Form Memories, Not Just The Brain: Study
content: A groundbreaking study by New York University (NYU) reveals that memory formation isnt limited to brain cells but may occur in various body cells, altering our understanding of memory.
summary: A groundbreaking study by New York University (NYU) reveals that memory formation isnt limited to brain cells but may occur in various body cells, altering our understanding of memory.

title: Deja Vu: Trump's 2024 Victory Follows 2016 Script

title: World First: Stem Cell Transplant Restores Sight In Multiple Patients
content: Two years after surgery, three patients experienced improved corneal transparency with no serious side effects.

title: Latest Pinaka System Tested As France, Armenia Line-Up To Buy Rockets
content: Amid a rise in global demand for it, India today successfully completed the flight-test of its advanced guided weapon system Pinaka. During the test, the Pinaka system's range, accuracy, consistency and rate of fire were assessed.

title: New Zealand MP Leads Traditional Dance, Rips Up Copy Of Bill In Parliament
content: New Zealand's youngest MP Hana-Rawhiti Kareariki Maipi-Clarke, who shot to viral fame after she performed a haka during her maiden speech in parliament last year, is back in the limelight after once again staging the traditional Maori dance and rippi

title: SpaceX Launches 24 Starlink Satellites In Back-To-Back Space Missions
content: SpaceX completed a remarkable coast-to-coast double launch on November 14, expanding its Starlink satellite network with 24 new satellites.
summary: SpaceX completed a remarkable coast-to-coast double launch on November 14, expanding its Starlink satellite network with 24 new satellites.

title: India Steps Up Extradition Bid For Terrorist Arsh Dalla, Arrested In Canada
content: India will follow up a November 10 request to Canada to extradite terrorist Arshdeep Gill, alias Arsh Dalla, the de facto chief of the banned Khalistan Tiger Force, the Foreign Ministry said Thursday.
summary: India will follow up a November 10 request to Canada to extradite terrorist Arshdeep Gill, alias Arsh Dalla, the de facto chief of the banned Khalistan Tiger Force, the Foreign Ministry said Thursday.

title: Minnesota Braces For Potential Winter Storm Next Week
content: Minnesota is preparing for a potential winter storm next week, with forecast models predicting a shift from rain to snow, especially in central and northern areas as colder air moves in.

title: This Trump Pick Might Spell Trouble For Indian Techies, H-1B Visa Seekers

title: US Capitol Celebrates Diwali In First Post-Election Event

title: In Choosing His Team, Trump Opts For Personal Ties, TV Chops

title: How Gunfight In Canada Led To Khalistani Terrorist Arshdeep Dalla's Arrest

title: King Charles Turns 76 Today, These Are His Plans For The Day
